Top ways to experience Confluence of the Indus and Zanskar Rivers and nearby attractions The area Best nearby Restaurants 2 within 3 miles Attractions 2 within 6 miles See what other travelers are saying - One of the best bike trips of my lifeThe Confluence - Indus & Zanskar - At times, at the Sangam, the Indus River can be seen as shiny blue while the Zanskar river is dirty green. In the summer season, Zanskar is swollen and rapid, while Indus is comparatively calmer. In the winters, it is quite the opposite. Zanskar slows down, its flow is light and is completely frozen at a lot of places, enabling the legendary Chadar Trek. While Indus flows fast, with ice floating on it. Be it the summer or the winter season, the confluence of these two magnificent rivers is not a sight to be missed when you are in Ladakh. It is a remarkable depiction of nature's subtle magical nuances. Visited September 2019Written June 11, 2020 - Mesmerizing and beautifulOne of nature's finest creation to be looked at and be amazed. Nestled between gigantic barren mountains, the two rivers, Indus and Zanskar find themselves to be united at this point. The shadow of the mountains and the colours of sky paint a confluence of pictures on the water surface. The water body is simply mesmerizing. It is a great spot to do river rafting as the current seems to be very tame. Aug 2013 Family I HAVE SEEN LAKES IN SWITZERLAND, AUSTRIA AND ITALY BUT PANGONG TSO IS THE BEST. I think Pangong Tso is the best attraction, but for my two children and I, the exciting experience of white water rafting on the Zanskar river was perhaps one of the most exhilarating activities we have ever done. The rapids are Grade 3 and rafting 30km with a 10-minute break lasted a total of 3 hours. Our Indian guide Vicky Chetri divides his time rafting between Hrishikesh and Ladakh. They give you an orientation for 10 minutes and then off you go! When you hit a rapid, then follow the guide's instructions to a T - that way you don't get scared. There is often a canoeist who is never too far from you. Number 3 attraction would have to be the massive Buddha statue in Diskit, Nubra valley. Number 4 attraction would be Shanti Stupa in Leh, and close by Number 5 attraction is the glorious Army Hall of Fame Museum. Number Six attraction is the drive around Khardungla Pass at 18,000 feet. Please spend the first 2 days acclimatising in Leh. Absolute must. This time of the year Leh would be freezing cold - therefore you must carry good jackets, warm clothes, gloves etc to keep yourself warm. Also since Leh is a high altitude place, you should carry medicines like Diamox tablets to help you get rid of mountain sickness.
